IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROMOTING MORE LIVEABLE,ECONOMICALLY SUSTAINABLE AND ENVIRONMENTALLY RESPONSIBLE GROWTH ON LONG ISLAND THROUGH SMART GROWTH- FOCUSING ON INFILL, REDEVELOPMENT & OPEN SPACE PRESERVATION WHILE SUPPORTING MIXED USE & INCOME COMMUNITIES THAT ARE CONVENIENT,ATTRACTIVE & AFFORDABLE
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROMOTING MORE LIVEABLE,ECONOMICALLY SUSTAINABLE AND ENVIRONMENTALLY RESPONSIBLE GROWTH ON LONG ISLAND THROUGH SMART GROWTH- FOCUSING ON INFILL, REDEVELOPMENT & OPEN SPACE PRESERVATION WHILE SUPPORTING MIXED USE & INCOME COMMUNITIES THAT ARE CONVENIENT,ATTRACTIVE & AFFORDABLE
IRS990.Desc: OUTREACH, EDUCATION & ADVOCACYSMART GROWTH EDUCATION AND TRAINING: IN THE PAST 25 YEARS DELIVERED OVER 3,000 PRESENTATIONS TO LOCAL GOVERNMENT, BUSINESS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS. OUR ANNUAL LI SMART GROWTH SUMMIT DRAWS OVER 1000 LEADERS FROM COMMUNITIES, MUNICIPALITIES, AND LOCAL BUSINESSES ACROSS LONG ISLAND. SMART GROWTH ADVOCACY AND POLICY DEVELOPMENT: ADVOCACY FOR DOWNTOWN RVITALIZATION, INFRASTRUCTURE, WALKABLE COMMUNITIES & COMMUNITY BASED PLANNING.ONGOING ADVOCACY IN ALBANY AND WASHINGTON FOR LEGISLATION, BUDGETARY AND REGULATORY CHANGES IN TRANSPORTATION, SEWER INFRASTRUCTURE, CLEAN ENERGY AND ECONOMIC AND DOWNTOWN DEVELOPMENT TO SHAPE OVER 150 CODE AND POLICY CHANGES. LI MAIN STREET NEWS, OUR E-NEWSLETTER REACHES 25,000 LONG ISLANDERS WEEKLY. SOCIAL MEDIA EFFORTS INCLUDE A PRESENCE ON FACEBOOK AND OTHER PLATFORMS. INSTITUTED TV SHOW LI MAIN STREET NEWS THAT REACHES NEARLY 250000 VIEWERS. CONVENING REGIONAL LEADERSHIP AND SMART GROWTH: HOSTING T

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY VISIONING & DOWNTOWN REVITALIZATION-WORK IN 35 LOCATIONS TO ADVANCE COMMUNITY PROJECTS INCLUDING:HICKSVILLE, WESTBURY, BALDWIN, KINGS PARK, DEER PARK, RIVERHEAD, HUNTINGTON STATION, MASTIC/SHIRLEY, CORAM/MIDDLE ISLAND, FARMINGDALE, VALLEY STREAM, GREAT NECK PLAZA, CENTRAL ISLIP, WYANDANCH, AND ROOSEVELT AMONG OTHERS. THROUGHOUT THE PANDEMIC VLI PROVIDED OUTREACH TO LOCAL BUSINESSES FOR AID PROGRAMS & HELD MULTIPLE PRESS EVENTS WITH THE 45 DOWNTOWN LI MAIN STREET ALLIANCE. VISION ALSO WORKED WITHT THE PINK TIE DELIVERS ORGANIZATION TO DELIVER FOOD TO OVER 50 FOOD PANTRIES WITH 165 FOOD DELIVERIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VLI IS AMENDING THEIR 2021 RETURN TO REFLECT REDUCED REVENUES AND INCREASED EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Management duties delegation Part VI line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE ORGANIZATION IS AN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR NOT AN EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 governing body review Part VI line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WITH 45 BOARD MEMBERS VLI DOES NOT CIRCULATE THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING TO ALL MEMBERS. KEY OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS REVIEW THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING AND IT IS POSTED ON THEIR WEBSITE OR AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Conflict of interest policy compliance Part VI line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES AS WELL AS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT THE ORGANIZATIONS HEADQUARTERS AND PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CEO executive director top management comp Part VI line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS LARGELY COMPOSED OF LOCAL BUSINESS OWNERS WHO ARE AWARE OF PREVAILING WAGES IN THE AREA. IN ADDITION, ALL COMPENSATION AND SALARY INCREASES ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. COMPARISONS WITH OTHER ENTITIES AND JOB POSTINGS INDICATE VLI PAYS ITS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR LESS THAN OTHER COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other officer or key employee compensation Part VI line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS LARGELY COMPOSED OF LOCAL BUSINESS OWNERS WHO ARE AWARE OF PREVAILING WAGES IN THE AREA. IN ADDITION, ALL COMPENSATION AND SALARY INCREASES ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. COMPARISONS WITH OTHER ENTITIES AND JOB POSTINGS INDICATE VLI GENERALLY PAYS BELOW THE PREVAILING WAGE FOR A POSITION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing documents etc available to public Part VI line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE ORGANIZATIONS HEADQUARTERS, OR BY MAIL.
LINE 1F WAS REDUCED FROM $477565 TO $428564 DUE TO SEVERAL SPONSORSHIP INVOICES FOR VIRTUAL SPECIAL EVENTS BEING FORGIVEN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: List of other expenses Part IX line 24e
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BANK FEES INCREASED $100 TO REFLECT A PROCESSING FEE IMPOSED ON THE SBA LOAN RECEIVED IN 2021.

LINE 4 ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE WAS DECREASED FROM $334734 TO $277734 TO REFLECT RECEIVABLES FOR VIRTUAL SPECIAL EVENT SPONSORSHIPS BEING FORGIVEN AS WELL AS $4000 IN GRANTS BEING RECLASSIFIED AS AN EXPENSELINE 9 PREPAID EXPENSES WAS REDUCED FROM $4139 TO $3169 TO PROPERLY REFLECT RENT EXPENSE AND PREPAID RENTS.LINE 17 ACCOUNTS PAYABLE WAS INCREASED FROM $23095 TO $33467 PRIMARILY DUE TO THE INCREASE IN UNPAID RENT OBLIGATIONS AT YEAR END 2021.LINE 19 DEFERRED REVENUE WAS DECREASED BY $8000 TO $110000 TO REFLECT DECREASE IN SPECIAL EVENT SPONSORSHIPS FOR 2022 BILLED IN 2021.LINE 23 SECURED DEBT WAS INCREASED BY $100 TO $150000 TO REFLECT $100 FEE DEDUCTED FROM LOAN PROCEEDS.LINE 27 NET ASSETS WITHOUT DONOR RESTRICTIONS DECREASED FROM $115934 TO $55492 AS A RESULT OF THE ABOVE CHANGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part IX response or note to any line in Part IX
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 13 OFFICE EXPENSE INCREASED $2000 FROM $6094 TO $8094 TO REFLECT THE EXPENSING OF A DONATED COPY MACHINE.LINE 16 OCCUPANCY INCREASED FROM $37367 TO $42708 TO REFLECT ADDITIONAL RENT EXPENSES. LINE 1 WAS INCREASED BY $4000 TO PROPERLY REFLECT THE EXPENSE OF 2 SMALL BUSINESS GRANTS MADE IN 2021 THAT HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN REFLECTED AS RECEIVABLES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI response or note to any line in Part XI
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 1 TOTAL REVENUE DECREASED TO $574604 FROM $623605 DUE TO THE CANCELLING OF SEVERAL LARGE SPECIAL EVENT SPONSORSHIP INVOICES IN 2021 AS THESE EVENTS WERE HELD VIRTUALLY DUE TO COVID. AND THE RECLASSIFICATION OF $4000 FROM ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE TO SMALL BUSINESS GRANT EXPENSE.LINE 2 TOTAL EXPENSES INCREASED FROM $541212 TO $552653 LARGELY DUE TO AN INCREASE IN RENT, OFFICE EXPENSES AND SMALL BUSINESS GRANTS AS EXPLAINED ELSEWHERE.LINE 10 NET ASSETS DECREASED FROM $132066 TO $71624 AS A RESULT OF THE ABOVE CHANGES.

SCHEDULE A PAGE 3 LINE 1E HAS BEEN INCREASED FROM $477565 TO $485344 TO PROPERLY REFLECT 2021 ACTIVITY INCLUDING FORGIVENESS OF PPP LOAN IN THE AMOUNT OF $56780 AND DECREASE IN RECEIVABLES PREVIOUSLY EXPLAINED.SCHEDULE G PART II LINE 1A HAS BEEN DECREASED BY $20000; LINE 1B DECREASED BY $4000; LINE 1C DECREASED BY $1000. THESE ALL REPRESENT SPONSORS WHO INVOICES WERE FORGIVEN WHEN EVENTS WERE HELD VIRTUALLY DUE TO COVID.
